archetype_name: Family Skillet Curries & Stir-Fries (Medium Heat, 15–30, Intermediate)
name: Tom Yum Chicken Fried Rice with Baby Corn and Snow Peas
description: A bright, medium-heat skillet fried rice using tom yum paste, tender chicken, and crisp vegetables. Quick microwave rice keeps it weeknight-fast while the wok brings the flavor.
prep_steps: Dice chicken thighs into small bite-size pieces.
Thinly slice onions and spring onion (separate whites and greens).
Slice bell pepper; drain baby corn and cut into bite-size pieces if large.
Rinse snow peas and pat dry.
In a small bowl, stir together tom yum paste and soy sauce.
Microwave rice according to packet directions and fluff; keep warm.
cook_steps: Heat canola oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat until shimmering.
Add chicken thighs, season lightly with salt, and stir-fry until browned and just cooked through, 4–5 minutes; push to one side.
Add onions (and spring onion whites) and garlic to the empty side; stir-fry 1 minute until fragrant.
Add bell pepper, baby corn, and snow peas; stir-fry 2–3 minutes until crisp-tender.
Pour in chicken stock and the tom yum–soy mixture; toss everything to coat and simmer 30–60 seconds.
Add the hot rice to the pan; toss vigorously to combine and dry-fry 1–2 minutes so the grains pick up sauce.
Sprinkle chili flakes to taste for medium heat; adjust salt or soy sauce if needed.
Finish with a squeeze of lime and the spring onion greens; serve hot.
